description:
In postgres we are not able to create two times Enum with the same name.

So If we try to make a shadow table for table we will get exception that Enum with the same name already exists.

So we should rename our Enum. 
I think that shadow_prefix + original_name will be good convention.
title: db.utils.create_shadow_table() doesn't work if we have table with Enum column

comments.content:
In postgres we are not able to create two times Enum with the same name.

So If we try to make a shadow table for table we will get exception that Enum with the same name already exists.

So we should rename our Enum. 
I think that shadow_prefix + original_name will be good convention.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~boris-42

comments.content: The first review  was abandoned and the second review doesn't seem to exist.  Does anyone have an update on this?  Looks pretty serious if it breaks all migrations with an Enum on postgres.

comments.content: At this moment we don't use Enum, so it is not important at all
